result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mckenna Leigh Chriske

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mckenna Leigh Chriske not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Mckenna Leigh Chriske.  Attorney Tyler Rubenzer in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Court waives defendant's appearance. 
Defendant has pending matters in Washington County. For reasons set forth in the record, defense counsel requests a status date. Court grants request. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mckenna Leigh Chriske in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Mckenna Leigh Chriske.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for review hearing. 
State places status on the record and revokes the informal DPA agreement.
Defense counsel informed the Court that defendant is on a waitlist for Roger's In-Patient Treatment and has pending cases in Washington County. 
Based upon the defendant's incompliance with the informal Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Mckenna Leigh Chriske not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Mckenna Leigh Chriske.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for review hearing.
Defendant's appearance waived by the Court.
For reasons set forth in the record, defense counsel requests an adjournment. State does not object.
Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 13.
Review hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mckenna Leigh Chriske in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mckenna Leigh Chriske appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: MK. Case was scheduled for plea/sentencing. Court proceeded with informal deferred prosecution agreement. Offer placed on the record. Defendant is to avoid contact with Festival Foods located at 5600 S 108th St. Hales Corner, WI. Defendant has 4 months to pay restitution to Festival Foods. Upon completion of the timeframe and restitution payment, the state is willing to amend this case to a ticket. Failure to comply will result in defendant serving 10 days in the House of Corrections. Court adjourned matter for review hearing. Case remains calendared in Br. 37.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mckenna Leigh Chriske in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mckenna Leigh Chriske appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Contact Order with Festival Foods 5600 S 108th Street Hales Corners WI.

Defendant Mckenna Leigh Chriske in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Mckenna Leigh Chriske
Current: 2541 Highway 28, Kewaskum, WI 53040   (Effective: 02-23-2022)
Prior: 2533 West Saint Johns Way, Oak Creek, WI 53154
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/23/22 @ 2p
